channel.title: Moparscape & Moparcraft?
channel.description:
Just a quick question between MoparCraft.net and MoparScape.org
How did you guys get 2 different SMF forums (i know the forums arent hard to get) and have both of the forums using the same login system? Like what im asking is how did you guys get the moparscape login to work on moparcraft?
I wanted to know how you guys use 2 different SMF forums with the same users database in order to have 2 forums running under the same user database. I didnt even register here on moparcraft i was registered on moparscape and got into this from my moparscape user and pass.
I wanted to know. It sort of fascinates me. I have wanted to do this with mybb once and im just wandering how you guys do it.
I also noticed that when i post here and check my recent posts on my account on moparscape the posts are added. It really fascinates me on how you guys did this.
I would love to know how you guys were able to have 2 different boards work with each other to have a universal posting and user database type thing. Like how is it done and how would i do this? i know its a little off topic but it just fascinates me and i want to know how you guys did it.
Thanks

item.title: Moparscape & Moparcraft?
item.dc:creator: @alex809 alex809
item.description:
@alex809 wrote:

Thats cool. Thanks Si Force

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape & Moparcraft?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

We use a modification called ‘Multi-forum mod’, or atleast I think it’s that. I’ll get you a link for it now.

edit: You can find the modification here. An administrator here created the modification.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape & Moparcraft?
item.dc:creator: @alex809 alex809
item.description:
@alex809 wrote:

Thanks. I may use this at some point. I think i would use it for another forum so i have a seperate forum for my minecraft server that way its seperate from my main forums and i can still have the same user database etc.

Could be cool.

Read full topic
